title: ORBITFLOW: SLO-Aware Long-Context LLM Serving with Fine-Grained KV Cache Reconfiguration
summary: The article presents ORBITFLOW, a novel approach designed to enhance the efficiency of serving long-context language models (LLMs) while adhering to specified Service Level Objectives (SLOs). It introduces a fine-grained key-value (KV) cache reconfiguration mechanism that optimizes cache management to reduce latency and improve performance under varying load conditions. title: Report: ICE Using Palantir Tool That Feeds On Medicaid Data
summary: The article reports on a concerning development involving U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) using a data tool developed by Palantir Technologies to access Medicaid data. title: New StackWarp Hardware Flaw Breaks AMD SEV-SNP Protections on Zen 1–5 CPUs
summary: Researchers have uncovered a hardware vulnerability, termed "StackWarp," that affects AMD's Secure Encrypted Virtualization-Secure Nested Paging (SEV-SNP) technology, compromising the security of Zen 1 through Zen 5 processors. The flaw enables potential attackers to manipulate the stack frame, allowing unauthorized access to sensitive data within encrypted virtual environments. This discovery raises significant concerns about the efficacy of AMD's hardware-based security features designed to protect virtual machines from being compromised. title: Digital Metabolism: Decoupling Logic from Facts via Regenerative Unlearning -- Towards a Pure Neural Logic Core
summary: In the article "Digital Metabolism: Decoupling Logic from Facts via Regenerative Unlearning -- Towards a Pure Neural Logic Core," the authors propose a novel approach to artificial intelligence by separating logical reasoning from factual information through a process termed regenerative unlearning. This method aims to create a "pure neural logic core" that can operate independently of data-driven biases, enhancing the AI's ability to understand and process logical structures without being influenced by specific datasets.
